summary: Outputs a list of intervals that are covered to or above a given threshold

arguments.summary: Threshold for the probability of a profile state being active.
arguments.name: --activeProbabilityThreshold

arguments.summary: The active region extension; if not provided defaults to Walker annotated default
arguments.name: --activeRegionExtension

arguments.summary: Use this interval list file as the active regions to process
arguments.name: --activeRegionIn

arguments.summary: The active region maximum size; if not provided defaults to Walker annotated default
arguments.name: --activeRegionMaxSize

arguments.summary: Output the active region to this IGV formatted file
arguments.name: --activeRegionOut
arguments.fulltext:
If provided, this walker will write out its active and inactive regions
 to this file in the IGV formatted TAB deliminated output:

 http://www.broadinstitute.org/software/igv/IGV

 Intended to make debugging the active region calculations easier

arguments.summary: Output the raw activity profile results in IGV format
arguments.name: --activityProfileOut
arguments.fulltext:
If provided, this walker will write out its activity profile (per bp probabilities of being active)
 to this file in the IGV formatted TAB deliminated output:

 http://www.broadinstitute.org/software/igv/IGV

 Intended to make debugging the activity profile calculations easier

arguments.summary: The sigma of the band pass filter Gaussian kernel; if not provided defaults to Walker annotated default
arguments.name: --bandPassSigma

arguments.summary: The minimum allowable coverage to be considered covered
arguments.name: --coverage_threshold

arguments.summary: If provided, all bases will be tagged as active
arguments.name: --forceActive
arguments.fulltext:
For the active region walker to treat all bases as active.  Useful for debugging when you want to force something like
 the HaplotypeCaller to process a specific interval you provide the GATK

arguments.summary: The minimum allowable base quality score to be counted for coverage
arguments.name: --minBaseQuality

arguments.summary: The minimum allowable mapping quality score to be counted for coverage
arguments.name: --minMappingQuality

arguments.summary: An output file created by the walker.  Will overwrite contents if file exists
arguments.name: --out

arguments.summary: output intervals that fail the coverage threshold instead
arguments.name: --uncovered

description:
The output list can be used as an interval list for other tools. The logic can be inverted using the -uncovered argument argument to instead output intervals that fail the coverage threshold.

Application example: find and diagnose low-coverage regions

Run this toool first with the -uncovered argument to identify regions that have low coverage. Then run DiagnoseTargets on the output intervals to diagnose why they are poorly covered.

Input

One or more BAM files.

Output

List of covered (or uncovered) intervals.

Example

 java -jar GenomeAnalysisTK.jar \
   -T FindCoveredIntervals \
   -R reference.fasta \
   -I my_file.bam \
   [-cov 10 \]
   [-uncovered \]
   -o output.list
name: FindCoveredIntervals
